metadata.title: Convert Grams to Ounces – Weight Converter
metadata.description: Convert weight from Grams (g) to Ounces (oz), useful for interpreting metric recipes in imperial.

introduction: This converter transforms weight measurements from Grams to Ounces, enabling imperial interpretation of metric recipes.
International recipes use grams while US recipes use ounces and cups. Understanding conversion is essential for cooking.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 ounce equals exactly 28.3495 grams.
methodology: 1 oz = 28.3495 grams. To convert grams to ounces, divide by 28.3495. For example, 100 g ≈ 3.53 oz, 500 g ≈ 17.6 oz.
Nutrition information is provided in grams but cooking measurements in the US use ounces.
Understanding weight conversion enables use of recipes from any country.
This converter provides precise weight conversions for cooking and baking.
examples: Example 1 – Recipe: A 200-gram ingredient is approximately 7 ounces.
Example 2 – Nutrition: A 50-gram serving is approximately 1.8 ounces.
Example 3 – Baking: 250 grams of flour is approximately 8.8 ounces.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Grams to Ounces?
faqs.answer: 1 oz = 28.3495 grams. Divide grams by 28.3495 to get ounces.

faqs.question: How many ounces in a kilogram?
How do I convert recipe measurements?
faqs.answer: Grams ÷ 28.3495 = ounces. Milliliters = grams for water (1:1 ratio).

glossary.definition: Metric unit of mass, standard for cooking and nutrition worldwide.
Imperial unit of weight equal to 1/16 pound.
